channel.title: CSS Specificity :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description:
But what about two rules that conflict that appear in the same level of the cascade order? For example, given the CSS: p { color: black; } .warning { color: red; } what would the color of

be? You might say it would be red because the .warning CSS rules come after the p rules. And that would be true if the two rules had the same specificity. An example of that is:
